column1: 10:20|They arrived outside Brides of Bombay at twenty minutes past ten. This was never going to be an appointment Seb would be late for. Vijay didn’t comment when Seb asked him to park out of sight
column2: but he was surprised by his next instruction.|Cometh the Hour|Jeffrey Archer

column1: 10:20|"At 10:20 there was a gentle tap on the door and
“I hope you both enjoyed a good night’s sleep
Not much chance of that when you’re married to a caveman
column3: but kept her thoughts to herself."|Hidden in Plain Sight|Jeffrey Archer

column2: swelling up like a piece of fruit
column5: dozens of seeds. The flesh split open in midair
column6: spraying seeds like gentle buckshot into the bare skin of my arms
column7: leaving behind a faint trace of pain.

column1: “What time is it?” my cousin asked me. About eight inches shorter than me
column2: he had to look up when he talked.

column1: I glanced at my watch. “Ten twenty.”"|Blind Willow

10:20|At about ten o’clock the first tiny snowflakes came loitering down and settled on Jill’s arm. Ten minutes later they were falling quite thickly. In twenty minutes the ground was noticeably white.|The Silver Chair|C.S. Lewis
